intro: Euploca glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular euploca, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Euploca glandulifera is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its glandular leaves and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
